constraints.usage_instructions: Choose one action type from the list below. Populate the 'parameters' field in your response strictly according to the 'example_parameters' structure provided.

allowed_actions.description: Do nothing on the board, just wait or communicate. Use this when you want to talk, negotiate, or think without taking a game action.

internal_thinking.description: Private strategy. Plan your move logically here. Analyze the board, probabilities, and opponents. NOTE: Keep your logic HERE. Do not leak technical explanations into 'say_outloud'.

note_to_self.description: Save important observations for future turns (e.g., 'Player 3 is hoarding ore').

say_outloud.description: Table talk. Must be natural. If nothing interesting happened, leave empty. If frustrated or happy, express it briefly. mimic real chat: no capitalization sometimes, slang allowed but not forced.

type.description: The action type (must match one from allowed_actions in constraints)

parameters.description: Action parameters as JSON string. Example: {"node": 14} or {}

tools_schema.name: inspect_node
tools_schema.description: Get detailed information about a specific node on the board. USE THIS to verify node data instead of trying to interpret Arrays N and H yourself - this prevents hallucinations!

reasoning.description: Explain WHY you're inspecting this specific node. What are you trying to verify or learn?

tools_schema.name: find_best_nodes
tools_schema.description: Search for the best available nodes matching specific criteria. USE THIS instead of manually scanning the board - prevents missing opportunities!

reasoning.description: Explain your search strategy. What kind of position are you looking for and why?

min_pips.description: Minimum total pip value (probability). Good nodes have 10+, excellent have 12+

exclude_blocked.description: Skip nodes that cannot be built on (occupied or too close to other buildings)

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

tools_schema.name: analyze_path_potential
tools_schema.description: Analyze where a road path leads and what opportunities exist ahead. USE THIS to plan road building - shows ports and valuable nodes 1-2 steps away!

reasoning.description: Explain your road-building strategy. Why analyze this path? What are you hoping to reach?

from_node.description: Starting node ID (where you currently have a settlement/road)

direction_node.description: Specific neighbor to analyze, or omit to see all directions

max_depth.description: How many steps ahead to look (1 or 2)
